channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bins on pavement have to walk in road, 28th June
item.description:
Overflowing bins being picked at by birds rats cats and foxes. Litter from bins strewn across pavement and road and it stinks

item.title: No Littering Enforcement in Priory Gardens, 28th June
item.description:
The managed decline of Priory Gardens has gathered pace since idverde was persuaded to leave the depot at the end of March, with litter being tossed on the ground with impunity.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Goddington, London

item.title: Sand / grit spilled on Westminster Bridge Road, 28th June
item.description:
An amount of sand / grit has been spilled on Westminster Bridge Road where the road passes under the railway bridge heading in the direction of Lambeth North (left hand side of the carriageway between the Park Plaza Hotel and Lower Marsh). The sand is currently deep enough such that it is slippery for cycles and so causes a danger.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westminster Bridge Road, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant fly tipping large and small, 28th June
item.description:
Hawkins terrace is a fly tipping hotspot. There is yet again a trash pile developing out of the back of my property. Short term - Can this be removed Medium term - can more frequent checks be done on this road to collect trash seen as nothing has been done by the council to prevent or fine people. Longer term - what is the council doing as a preventative measure on this street. There is barely a week goes by that rubbish and old furniture isn’t present on this road. More should be done to prevent this from happening, it’s disgusting, and we pay a high council tax on Heathwood but see little effort put in in return

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 30, Hawkins Terrace, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The traffic control cameras seem not working at the junction Benhill rd/Elmington road, 28th June
item.description:
The same cars and motorbikes continue to cross the restricted junction despite the traffic signal and control cameras. This indicates that the cameras may not be functioning properly as they have never got fined. If that’s the case, please address this issue as soon as possible, as pedestrians, including young children, assume no vehicles will cross and could find themselves in dangerous situations. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Benhill Road, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet
